• 100 CSS tools – Tons of helpful tools for everyone that is even touching CSS.
  • Top 100 Fonts of all times – Most of these fonts are not cross-client resident, so they should be used in design, not as a font-family value, well, until CSS3 will be supported.
  • Recession Tip: Conveying value to client – how i hate client contracting, but for those of you who prefer it, that’s a good article on how to get you approach set right when you deal with a client.
  • Wikipedia Timeline with ruby – Things much like this project, drew me into Ruby and Rails in the first place… how fast are you making these stuff, it’s amazing.
    This is a mining tool for wikipedia, which allows you to compare between events on the same timeline, nice.
